review_blob: Pours a nice brown with thick foamy head that retains well. Aroma was sugar candy and light malted grains. First sip is sweet and smooth. Finishes clean and can hardly notice the alcohol content. Overall it tastes like candy with a bit of wood-flavours. Excellent brew.

From (clear) bottle -taken from the bottom shelf at the liquor store. Pours dark amber with nice off-white head that retains. Aroma is oak whiskey vanilla and skunk. First sip is rich ,malty caramel, with woodiness, vanilla and skunk. Aftertaste is skunk. If they insist on clear bottles, they should insist on dark stores...

From bottle -pours copper amber hue with nice thin white head that retains. well carbonated but not overly so. Aroma is grapefruit and citrusy hops. First sip is slightly bitter with a bit of fruit astringency (grapefruit). Balanced well with caramel malt sweetness. No booziness present but alcohol content is higher than average. Overall this is a decently balanced beer, and I know from experience that grapefruit is a fickle fruit to brew with.
beer_name: Howe Sound Super Jupiter Grapefruit IPA

review_blob:
From bottle- pours dark flat black with good creamy dark brown head. Very well carbonated.
Aroma is slight chocolate malt.
First sip is dark chocolate with creamy finish.
Very decent. 
Slight roast coffee flavour as it warms

from bottle. Aroma is straw. Pours pale yellow with thin head and lots of carbonation. First sip is sweet straw with almost cough medicine aftertaste. Almost easy to drink but I get hung up on the straw/syrup finish.

Probably be good with sushi?

From bottle -pours yellow gold with medim creamy head. 
Aroma is mild hoppy citrusy with hint of mint and pine.
First sip is creamy citrus hoppy goodness. So worth the wait and hardship of finding it.
No bitter aftertaste. Aftertase is creamy sweet with citrus and mint.

From bottle -Pours pale brown, with thin head. Aroma is sour apple and slight caramel.
First sip is sour apple with a slight caramel slight sweetness. Reminicent of a caramel apple, but sour with a hint of woodiness.
Smooth aftertaste.
beer_name: Driftwood Mad Bruin Sour Brown Ale

review_blob:
From tap -pours flat black, visible head dissipates quickly.
Aroma is chili and chocolate.
First sip is hot spicy chili with chocolate. Spicy chili aftertaste that burns slowly.
beer_name: Elysian 12 Beers of Apocalypse # 4 - Peste Chocolate Chili Ale

review_blob:
From bottle -pours light-wheat brown
Aroma is bubble gum and pacific northwest hops.
First sip is bubble gum floral with mild sweetness.
Aftertaste is mild sweet spiciness.

From bottle.  Aroma is Toffee, vanilla and malt. Pours reddish-brown with slight head. Big vanilla taste up front that fades fast. Sweet, light-bodied. A little thin with a watery finish. Would enjoy stronger longer lastign flavours.
From bottle - Aroma is sweet pumpkina nd brown sugar. First sip is cola-like syrupy sweetness and nutmeg spice. Quite rich and overly sweet. Aftertaste is sweet caramel malts.
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2012
Aroma is faint pumpkin spice. First sip is caramel brown ale. Boozy and pumpkin spice. Aftertaste is nutmeg.
Aroma is oak wood and malty sweetness. First sip is oak sour and caramel sweet malts. Aftertaste is dextrin sugar and smooth oakiness.
Pours dark with mediun head foam stays. Aroma is chocolatey. First sip is watery smokey dark malts with a deep sweetness. Aftertaste is clean. Not bad. Clean finish but too rich to drink much of.
beer_name: Parallel 49 Lost Souls Chocolate Pumpkin Porter

review_blob: UPDATED: OCT 29, 2012
Bourbon barrell aged from bottle.  Pours brown with good head. Well carbonated.  Aroma is sweetness and slight bourbon sourness.  First sip is tangy sweet and tart. Aftertase is slight dark fruits.
beer_name: Central City Thors Hammer Barley Wine - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Pours copper. Aroma of straw and slight barley sweetness. Nice thin head that remains. First sip is sweet and straw with subtle hint of hops. Tastes clean and refreshing. Aftertaste is sweet with hint of hop bitterness. Very fine indeed.
From bottle aroma is strawberry jam. First sip is sickly sweet strawberry with tart aftertaste. Colour is a nice bronze. Finish is tart almost sour. Not bad. Would go well with toast and bacon.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic  Strawberry Fruit Beer

review_blob: Pours pale yellow almost see throufh with slight head that dissipates. Aroma is clovey and slight banana. First sip is clovey sweet and refreshing. Aftertaste is banana bubble gum.
Aroma is apricot jam. Flavour is apricot jam. Very tastey. Pours golden yellow. Thin head.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic  Apricot  Fruit Beer

review_blob: Aroma is raspberry jam. Flavour is raspberry and classic brown with nice honey malt tones.  Aftertaste is slighlt sourness and raspberry jam.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic Raspberry Fruit Beer

review_blob: Sweet caramel aroma. Flavour is yeasty and sweet brown.  Very flavourful. Raisin and plum.
Sweet smokey aroma. Flavour is cherry sweetness with smoked peat and light bacon.  Slight sourness from the oak. Very tasty.
beer_name: R & B Darksnout Bourbon Barrel Aged Bacon Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: From Bottle - pours caramel brown with a malty sweet aroma and a hint of smoked peat. My first sip is sweet with a bit of smokiness at the back.  Aftertatse is toffee. Quite good!
beer_name: Boundary Bay Scotch Ale - Highland Reserve

review_blob:
From bottle -Label evokes lumberjack imagery. Pours dark copper brown with nice head that thins out. Aroma of caramel malts and almost woodsy hop character. 
First sip shows this brew to be well balanced. No particular flavour stands out, but makes for an easy drinking ale. Nice carbonation on the tongue. Good bodied malt flavour.
Overall this is a good patio beer.

Pours honey brown with thick white head good lacing.
Aroma is citrus and pine hops. Smells sweet.
First sip is creamy citrus fruit and very smooth.  Very little bitter or booze.
Aftertaste is sweet hop juice.  Much like hop stoopid  Very tastey and very easy to drink.  Bravo.
Lots of creaminess.
beer_name: Fernie Lone Wolf India Pale Ale

review_blob: From bottle. Pours goldeb yellow with thick foamy head. Aroma is hint of apricot. First sip is slightly fruity. Aftertaste is sweet.  Slightly watery.

Pours medium brown nice thick white head.  Aroma is faint caramel malts with toffee.
First  sip is full of sour carmel apple esters.
Aftertaste is sweet apple that lingers.

Pours dark amber brown with thick light brown foamy head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is caramel fruitiness.
First sip is apple and super boozey.
Aftertaste is crisp apple booze and toffee.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012
From bottle pours a nice magenta with foamy white head.  First sip is smooth sweet with strong raspberry sour at the back. Nice summer sipping beer.
beer_name: Granville Island False Creek Raspberry Ale

review_blob: From bottle.  Very dark. Aroma is slight molasses and candy. First is smooth sweet slightly nutty candy. Aftertaste is malty sweet slightly fruity with vegetal notes.

From draft -Pours light gold with few bubbles and a thin head that disappears. Aroma is slight malt and hops. First sip is slight straw with fruit undertone. Dry and clean. Rather fuller bodied for a lager. Finishes dry and straw like.
From tap. Aroma is spritzy with carbonation hay aroma. First is sharp grassy and carbonated. Slight hay notes with mild sweetness. Aftertaste is hoppy bitterness.  Very good and quaffable

From bottle -Pours dark brown with medium head that lasts.
Aroma is caramel with slight nut smell.
First sip is sweet. caramel with nut aftertaste.
Very tasty. Slightly sweet but delicious.
beer_name: Howe Sound Rail Ale Nut Brown

review_blob:
From bottle -Pours bronze with slight head. Aroma has slight jasmin and lavender aroma
First sip reveals a flowery watery taste.  It is very mild and easy drinking. Not much bitterness or hop presence.
Aftertaste leaves a clean floral note.

From bottle -pours light copper tone with slight white head that dissappears fast.
Aroma is slight ginger and rye.  First sip reveals sweetness with rye bread doughiness. There is a nice light ginger tingle. Overall this tastes light and bready. Aftertase has a slight ginger spicey sweetness. As it warms up, more ginger spice is evident.  Very drinkable with just enough kick to make it interesting.

From bottle -pours a clear amber hue, with slight off-white head that dissipates.
Aroma is slight sour cherry sweetness.
First sip barley grainy with sweet and sour.
Aftertaste is light fruit tea.
beer_name: Duchy Originals Organic Old Ruby Ale 1905

review_blob:
From Bottle -Pours cloudy pale yellow with thick foamy white head
Aroma is doughy and grassy with hint of banana and clove.
First sip is light and refreshing citrusy with belgian breadiness. 
Aftertaste is grass and citrus.

Draft-Pours black with creamy foamy head that is brown sugar color.
Aroma is sugary sweet dark roast malts.
First sip is sweet and boozey. Coffee and chocolate roast malts very present. slight fruity esters
Aftertaste is dry sweet fruits.
beer_name: Russell Rick August Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Pours pale gold yellow.  Aroma is grassy and light malt.  First sip is crisp clean and slightly grassy. Good summer beer, definitely a good lager.  Lots of champagne like bubbles. Would recommend for lager lovers.

Draft- pours copper with thick foamy white head.
Aroma of citrusy/pine chinook hops.
First sip is clean and crisp with nice hoppy bitterness. Citrus aftertaste.

Draft -pours cloudy pale yellow.
Aroma is watermelon bubble gum.
First sip reveals refreshing, light watermelon flavour with a lingering sweetness.
Aftertaste is watermelon bubble gum juice finish. Dry.

Pours copper brown with small head that dissappears
Aroma is spicey hops and sweet bitterness
First taste is smooth and spicey, slightly astringent.
Aftertaste is grassy with spice.

Had at Van Home brewer awards 2012 @rickshaw theatre.  Pours deep brown with low head.  Good carbonation.
Smells of sour malt vinegar.
Taste is green apple/cranberry sour
Bitter mouth feel.
Aftertaste is sour apple.
beer_name: Yaletown Wild Belgian Bruin (Oud Bruin) 100% Oak Aged

review_blob:
Pours mahogany brown thick creamy off white head that stays

Aroma is sweet malty scent with slight hop smell in there

First sip is sweet malty: caramel and toffee notes a bit saltiness and a bit fruit like.
Very good beer. Dont taste the alcohol much
Aftertaste is like caramel apple.  Caramel fruit esters.

Pours pale yellow with good bubbles.
Aroma is bubblegum and doughy yeast
First sip reveals tingly mouthfeel.  Slight banana bubblegum at the front finishes straw like.  Smooth.
Aftertaste is doughy yeasty finish. As this beer warms up, more clove flavour and aroma is noticeable.  As well it seems a tad watery, but maybe thats just me being accustomed to the high alcohol stouts.

Pours flat soda brown.  Good carbonation.
Rich sweet malty aroma.  Almost like syrup
First taste reveals strong grassy-sweet flavour with fruit after.  Almost like pop mixed with juice. Very sweet.  Nice lemon and lime presence.
Its very tasty
Aftertaste is sweet lime.
Bit of a belgian sour yeastiness aftertaste.

Pours dark black with large thick creamy head that dissipates slowly.
Aroma is creamy malts with light coffee and chocolate scent.
First sip is creamy sweet like coffee ice cream and chocolate.  Slight nuttiness present. Medium to strong sweetness with a slight bitter finish.  Tastes very good!
As it wams up there is more chocolate more bitter and slight saltiness
